,TRUE,5,4,5,5,5 Rainbowice","2016-05-13T13:50:56.473Z","Great Playability","

I really enjoy this set! I think that you get quite a bit for you money, (£
column3: ) maybe just a smidgen over priced.

column1: I enjoyed building most of this and it was reasonably easy apart from the mob spawner spin function, though that is one of my favorite parts of the set.

The playability of this set is really good! First of all if you put one of the zombies on a section of the floor and pull a little bit of the rock that juts of of the wall, it will give the impression of a new zombie spawning into the dungeon. Secondly there is a little round brick concealed within the rock, if you give it a spin, there is a little zombie in the spawner that will spin around. This is a reference to the mob spawner animation in the game.
There is also a little chest in the corner of the dungeon which contains 2 pieces of wheat and a couple of trans-red dot elements, which I guess, is supposed to be a piece of redstone.

column3: is really good. The are only two walls which is really great for&nbsp
column4: playability. The set really looks like the actual dungeon in the game with the mossy cobblestone and iron ore. The only thing which isn&#39
column5: t very accurate is the patch of lava with a cactus in the middle, though I&#39
column6: m not really complaining as it looks quite cool.

column1: Overall really positive comments on this set! I would recommend this to

,TRUE,4,4,4,5,4 Schmoobin","2017-06-03T02:16:08.887Z","So Many Functions!","

I am a huge fan of Minecraft, but when Lego started producing Minecraft sets, I was a bit skeptical at first.
column2: Now, I have obtained The Dungeon, I have been starting to like the theme.

column1: The box is a standard Lego Minecraft box, and is the perfect size for a small set like this.
column3: front displays the model itself, with Steve being chased by zombies in the dungeon, with a cobblestone background. &nbsp
column4: The back of the box illustrates all the functions that come with this nifty set. &nbsp

column1: Now once we have opened the box, you get the instructions.
column3: s a standard instruction box, albeit&nbsp
column4: it is large for such a small set, packed with 49 pages and advertisements on the back pages for other Minecraft sets and the Lego website. &nbsp

column2: t any unique parts to the set other than minifigure pieces and pieces 6093263 and 6093244, parts to the small zombie for the spawner

column1: The minifigures include two zombie figures and a Steve figure.
column2: Steve is armed with only a pickaxe.

column1: There is nothing too special or unique about this build except for a couple of functions.
column2: Bag one contains all of the small builds. &nbsp
column3: These include the minifigures, cactus, spawner, blocks and a small sand area. &nbsp
column4: The spawner was the most interesting build. &nbsp
column5: When you build it, you place a small gear right below it.

column1: Bag two contains the main build, the dungeon.
column2: After we build the dungeon itself, we place the small builds within it. &nbsp
column3: The most interesting thing about this a small area that spins. &nbsp
column4: At the end of that area is a gear, which attaches to the gear on the spawner. &nbsp
column5: Once you place the spawner, you will be able to spin it while rolling your finger across a cylindrical piece.

column3: s pretty accurate to the source material. &nbsp
column5: s clearly right below a few blocks of sandstone when in the game, dungeons tend to be spawned much lower, but it looks good as a design. &nbsp
column7: m just wondering why there would be a cactus spawning underground. &nbsp

column1: • Small trap door on the side of the model that might either represent a manmade trap or a creeper explosion.
• By rolling your finger on the cylindrical piece in the ground, you can make the small zombie spin in the spawner.
• Accessing the chest, full of wheat and redstone

column3: s a good model, and while it might not be the best for display, this model is packed with playability. &nbsp
column5: re a Minecraft fan and you have a small budget, I definitely recommend this set!
